an5.55:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
an5.55:1.2: Now, at that time a mother and son had both entered the rainy season residence at Sāvatthī,
an5.55:1.3: as a monk and a nun.
an5.55:1.4: They wanted to see each other often.
an5.55:1.5: The mother wanted to see her son often,
an5.55:1.7: Seeing each other often, they became close.
an5.55:1.8: Being so close, they became intimate.
an5.55:1.9: And being intimate, lust overcame them.
an5.55:1.10: With their minds swamped by lust, without resigning the training and declaring their inability to continue, they had sex.
an5.55:2.1: Then several mendicants went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.
an5.55:3.1: “Mendicants, how could that silly man imagine that
an5.55:3.2: a mother cannot lust for her son, or that a son cannot lust for his mother?
an5.55:3.3: Compared to the sight of a woman, I do not see a single sight that is so arousing, sensuous, intoxicating, captivating, and infatuating, and such an obstacle to reaching the supreme sanctuary.
an5.55:3.4: Sentient beings are lustful, greedy, tied, infatuated, and attached to the sight of a woman.
an5.55:3.5: They sorrow for a long time under the sway of a woman’s sight.
an5.55:4.1: Compared to the sound … smell … taste … touch of a woman, I do not see a single touch that is so arousing, sensuous, intoxicating, captivating, and infatuating, and such an obstacle to reaching the supreme sanctuary.
an5.55:4.2: Sentient beings are lustful, greedy, tied, infatuated, and attached to the touch of a woman.
an5.55:4.3: They sorrow for a long time under the sway of a woman’s touch.
an5.55:5.1: When a woman walks, she occupies a man’s mind.
an5.55:5.2: When a woman stands … sits … lies down … laughs … speaks … sings … cries … is injured, she occupies a man’s mind. Even when a woman is dead, she occupies a man’s mind.
an5.55:5.3: For if anyone should be rightly called ‘an all-round snare of Māra’, it’s females.
an5.55:6.1: You might chat with someone who has knife in hand.
an5.55:6.2: You might even chat with a goblin.
an5.55:6.3: You might sit close by a viper,
an5.55:6.4: whose bite would take your life.
an5.55:6.6: one on one with a female.
an5.55:7.2: with a glance and a smile.
an5.55:7.5: It’s not good to sit with such a person,
an5.55:7.6: even if she’s injured or dead.
an5.55:8.1: These five kinds of sensual stimulation
an5.55:8.2: are apparent in a woman’s body:
an5.55:9.1: Those swept away by the flood of sensual pleasures,
an5.55:9.4: time and destination, and life after life.
an5.55:10.1: But those who fully understand sensual pleasures
an5.55:10.2: live fearing nothing from any quarter.
an5.55:10.3: They are those in the world who’ve crossed over,
an5.55:10.4: having reached the ending of defilements.”
